text: in April 2017 I spent three days in the

number one you cannot disrespect the
past or current leaders as it's a
criminal act and will lead you to prison
or worse this means Kim Il Sung Kim
jong-il and Kim jong-un don't even
mention their names even if it's
positive because the leaders are viewed
as gods and it's an extremely sensitive
topic especially if you're a foreigner
every tourist is required to bow when
visiting the Kim il-sung's statue and if
you take a photo of the leader his face
must be in full frame and not cut off
and don't bend the rules because they
will check your camera number two you
cannot take photos of any governmental
buildings police or construction
government stuff and police are
self-explanatory but they say no
construction photos because North
Koreans always want their country to be
presented in the most perfect way and
construction it shows that something is
not complete taking videos are allowed
to as long as you follow these
restrictions number three you cannot
leave the tour group at any time unless
you go during the Pyongyang marathon
like I did then you'll have four hours
of time to run the streets without being
supervised even when it's time to go
back to your hotel you are not allowed
to leave the property but there is a
bowling alley a bar and a nice
restaurant inside so it's all good other
rules are given to follow such as not
using local currency not going into
random shops or talking to strangers but
as long as you use common sense and
don't break the rules then you'll be in
for a very special treat to witness life
in the world's most isolated nation
